summary: Internal FBI email chain from August 2019 discussing victim outreach and services offered in the Epstein case. It provides statistics on victims contacted and services offered, including crisis counseling and interview assistance, in preparation for a weekly Significant Activity Report.

events.title: Upcoming hearing
events.description: Mentioned as an upcoming hearing for which victims were being updated.

keyFacts: As of August 15, 2019, the FBI's Victim Services Division had spoken to and offered services to 24 victims (17 in New York, 7 in Miami).
Services offered to victims included interview assistance, crisis counseling, information on talking to the media, and counseling referrals.
As of August 22, 2019, outreach was ongoing to 31 victims who were not represented by legal counsel, with one New York victim receiving in-person crisis counseling and referrals.
The FBI was preparing a weekly Significant Activity Report (SAR) on victim outreach in the Epstein case.
